name: Yerodin Cuellar
experience_text: +4 years of experience. Computer Engineer specialized in web development

experiences.description: Backend development in NestJS and frontend in Next.js, improving the experience for users and providers. Creation of an internal CRM and corporate landing pages to optimize online presence and attract new users.
Created a Flutter-based delivery app for remote areas, connecting local businesses with new customers. App with over 5k downloads.
Led the development of an LMS using NestJS and Next.js with SSR and secure authentication. Coordinated with stakeholders to ensure clear objectives and efficient functionality.
Migrated software from C++ to Next.js, improving user experience. Implemented real-time notifications and a chat module using Firebase.

projects.name: Quinti - Food Delivery App
projects.description: Food delivery app in Flutter for remote areas. Connecting local businesses with new customers. Over 5k downloads.

projects.name: Interactive Virtual Menu - ProCarta
projects.description: Interactive virtual menu for restaurants. Digital menu design with customization options and online ordering. Developed with Next.js and Tailwind CSS.

projects.name: Quinti Web - Marketplace for Restaurants
projects.description: Web version of Quinti, adapted with Next.js, Firebase, Tailwind CSS, and TypeScript to optimize the experience for users and restaurants.

about_me_text:
My name is Yerodin, and I am passionate about software development with over three years of experience in creating applications and technological solutions.

Some of my achievements include co-founding Quinti, a delivery app designed to connect local businesses in remote areas with new customers, and leading the development of an LMS at Multilingual Interpreters and Translators, optimizing processes and enhancing user experience.

Currently, at Kedo!, I am contributing to the company's growth by developing a robust backend, an internal CRM, and landing pages that improve online presence and attract new users. My focus is always on balancing technical performance with sound business judgment.
